frame.name: FR_Having_commercial_agreement
frame.definition:
<def-root>Two (or more) people (the <fen>Parties</fen>, also encodable as <fen>Party_1</fen> and <fen>Party_2</fen>, or <fen>Buyer</fen> and <fen>Seller</fen>) have a commercial agreement. Both sides are construed as having a commitment concerning a commercial transaction, or a series of commercial transactions. The <fen>Seller</fen> is committed to an <fen>Obligation</fen> in exchange of which <fen>Buyer</fen> is committed to paying them <fen>Money</fen>. Instead of a specific mention of the <fen>Obligation</fen>, a <fen>Topic</fen> expression may be used to indicate the domain covered.
<ex></ex>
<asf>Relation to fndata-1.5</asf> : lexicalized version of fndata-1.5's Having_commercial_agreement. Roles Money, Buyer and Seller were added.
</def-root>

FE.name: Party_1
FE.definition:
<def-root>The individual or individuals that form the more prominent (i.e. agentive) party of the commercial agreement, as compared with <fen>Party_2</fen>. That is, <fen>Party_1</fen> is generally encoded as the External Argument of verbs, and peripheral FEs that do not make reference to the event itself generally make reference to <fen>Party_1</fen>. Thus manner expressions are construed to apply to <fen>Party_1</fen>, not necessarily to <fen>Party_2</fen> or the group of <fen>Parties</fen> as a whole.
</def-root>

FE.name: Buyer
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Buyer</fen> is committed to paying <fen>Money</fen> to the <fen>Seller</fen> in exchange for their commitment to the <fen>Obligation</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Seller
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Seller</fen> is committed to an <fen>Obligation</fen> in exchange of which the <fen>Buyer</fen> is committed to paying them <fen>Money</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Party_2
FE.definition: <def-root>The semantically (and grammatically) less prominent participant (or group of participants) in the agreement. It is generally encoded within a prepositional phrase (e.g. headed by with). </def-root>

FE.name: Obligation
FE.definition: <def-root>An expression of the commitment which the <fen>Parties</fen> have to engage in a commercial transaction. </def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Topic</fen> is a description of the domain covered by the commercial agreement. </def-root>

FE.name: Money
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Money</fen> is the thing given in exchange for fulfilling the <fen>Obligation</fen> in a commercial agreement. </def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition:
<def-root>As with other frames in the Communication domain, the <fen>Medium</fen> of communication may be expressed. <fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used to record or negotiate the <fen>Obligation</fen>.
<ex>The parties have a <fex name="med">written</fex> <t>agreement</t> to arbitrate disputes arising in connection with the contract.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Parties
FE.definition: <def-root>The group of individuals portrayed as equally involved in having a commercial agreement. </def-root>

frameRelation.type: Relation to FN1.5: Is Close to
